conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and needs to be predicted whether it will flow into container E or F after passing through baffles.
A is the green inlet located at the top left.
B is the yellow inlet located at the top right.
C is the blue inlet located at the top center-right.
D is the light blue inlet located at the top right.
E is the white container located at the bottom left.
F is the blue container located at the bottom right.

premise: Stream A hits the green baffle and is deflected to the right.
conclusion: Liquid from A flows downward past the green baffle and continues toward the center-bottom area.

premise: Stream B and C strike the blue slanted barrier, merge, and are deflected to the right together.
conclusion: Liquid from B and C flows downward, guided by the blue baffle toward the center-bottom area.

premise: Stream D drops straight down without meeting any obstacles.
conclusion: Liquid from D flows directly downward toward the center-bottom area.

premise: All liquids from A, B, C, and D are directed toward the center-bottom area.
conclusion: Liquid flows toward the area where containers E and F are located.

premise: E is on the left and F is on the right, with liquid primarily flowing centrally.
